Activity: Arrive at work, log into the EHR system, and check emails for any urgent updates or announcements. Respond to any immediate queries from @Helpdesk-1 regarding EHR access issues encountered by other nurses.

Review the standardized protocols and tools for influenza symptom assessment within the EHR. Pay close attention to any recent updates or modifications implemented by @Clinlead-1 and documented by @his-1.
Prepare for the day's patient load by reviewing scheduled appointments and anticipating potential influenza cases based on current seasonal trends reported by @da-1 and @da-2.

Begin patient assessments. Accurately assess the first patient for influenza symptoms, using the standardized protocols and EHR-integrated tools. Meticulously document all observations and patient responses directly into the EHR.
Assess the second patient for influenza symptoms, using the standardized protocols and EHR-integrated tools. Meticulously document all observations and patient responses directly into the EHR.
Address the third patient for influenza symptoms, using the standardized protocols and EHR-integrated tools. Meticulously document all observations and patient responses directly into the EHR.
Lunch break. Review recent articles on Nursing.

Continue patient assessments. Accurately assess the fourth patient for influenza symptoms, using the standardized protocols and EHR-integrated tools. Meticulously document all observations and patient responses directly into the EHR.

Enter patient data into the EHR for patients seen this morning, ensuring all demographic information, medical history, vaccination status, symptoms, and lab results are accurately and completely recorded.
Assess the fifth patient for influenza symptoms, using the standardized protocols and EHR-integrated tools. Meticulously document all observations and patient responses directly into the EHR.

Review the day's documentation, ensuring accuracy and completeness. Address any discrepancies or missing information. Send an email to @mrs-1 and @mrs-2 to clarify if any medical history is not clear in the database, with @PEOPLE.
Prepare a summary report of potential influenza cases seen today and share it with @Clinlead-1 to assist with ongoing seasonal influenza trend analysis.
Log out of the EHR system and prepare for departure.
